questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Microsoft PowerPoint?
questions.feedback: Microsoft PowerPoint is primarily used for creating engaging presentations with slides.

questions.question: Which tab in PowerPoint allows you to apply themes to a presentation?
questions.feedback: The 'Design' tab in PowerPoint allows you to apply themes and customize slide layouts.

questions.question: Which view in PowerPoint displays thumbnails of all slides in a presentation?
questions.feedback: Slide Sorter view shows thumbnails of all slides, making it easier to rearrange them.

questions.question: What is the shortcut key to save a presentation in PowerPoint?
questions.feedback: Press Ctrl + S to quickly save your presentation.

questions.question: How can you add speaker notes to a slide in PowerPoint?
options: Use the 'Notes' pane below the slide
Right-click on the slide and choose 'Add Notes'
questions.correct: Use the 'Notes' pane below the slide
questions.feedback: Speaker notes can be added in the 'Notes' pane below the slide in Normal view.

questions.question: Which feature in PowerPoint lets you create a self-running presentation?
questions.feedback: The 'Set Up Slide Show' feature lets you configure a self-running presentation.

questions.question: What is the function of the 'Slide Master' in PowerPoint?
options: To customize the overall design of all slides
questions.correct: To customize the overall design of all slides
questions.feedback: The 'Slide Master' is used to apply consistent formatting to all slides in a presentation.

questions.question: What is the shortcut to insert a new slide in PowerPoint?
questions.feedback: Press Ctrl + M to quickly insert a new slide in PowerPoint.

questions.question: Which tool allows you to align objects on a slide in PowerPoint?
questions.feedback: The 'Align Tool' helps you arrange objects on a slide with precision.

questions.question: What does the 'Outline View' in PowerPoint display?
options: Slide text in a hierarchical format
questions.correct: Slide text in a hierarchical format
questions.feedback: The 'Outline View' displays only the text content of slides in a hierarchical format.
